thread.section_title: Financial Services News - Yahoo! Finance UK
thread.title: London close: Stocks sag as focus shifts to central banks
thread.title_full: London close: Stocks sag as focus shifts to central banks

title: London close: Stocks sag as focus shifts to central banks
text:
44.845 -0.030 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) ended the session lower in London as markets' focus shifted from the Greek crisis to central banks and corporate earnings. Nevertheless, traders breathed a sigh of relief after Germany's parliament approved starting talks with Greece on a third bail-out package and to ratify the provision of a bridge-loan to tidy the country over until a new full bailout package is in place, possibly in about a month's time. 
The FTSE 100 finished the session 21.37 points lower to 6,775.08, with shares of oil and commodity stocks leading losses as the US dollar continued to gain altitude. 
Interest rate expectations in the UK were also building up after central bank chief Mark Carney on Thursday evening said: "in my view, the decision as to when to start such a process of adjustment will likely come into sharper relief around the turn of this year." That pushed sterling to an eight-year high in so-called trade-weighted terms. In parallel, on Friday afternoon the US dollar was on track for its largest weekly gain in two months on the back of recent interest rate speculation Stateside. 
The higher equity-risk premium on euro area equities and prospects for growth in the Eurozone to converge with that in the US means European shares offer more upside potential than both UK and American stocks, Societe Generale (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) said in a research report e-mailed to clients. 
Lawmakers in Berlin were expected to show their support for a three-year rescue programme for Greece, but opposition was on the rise. In a test vote on Thursday 48 members of Chancellor Angela Merkel's own conservative party voted against new negotiations, up from the 29 who opposed an extension of the current rescue package back in February. 
The Aegean nation's "systemic" importance for the euro area hasn't been demonstrated," Christian von Stetten, from Merkel's own Christian Democratic Union, said Thursday. 
"There can only be one vote tomorrow, and that is no." US earnings in focus Acting as a backdrop, US corporate earnings were increasingly in focus as the fog surrounding the Greek crisis began to clear. 
So far this earnings season 71% of companies had beaten consensus forecasts. Expectations were for S&P 500 earnings to fall by 4.3% - their first year-on-year decline since 2009. However, the entirety of the drop could be accounted for by lower profits in the oil patch. 
That came as shares in Google (Xetra: A0B7FY - news ) rocketed by 11% after the close of US markets the day before 0 which saw the Nasdaq-100 break out to a new 15-year record closing high - following its latest results. 
M&S's Dixon to step down Online gambling company 888 Holdings has agreed to buy Bwin.party Digital Entertainment in a cash and stock deal worth around Â£898.3m, beating a rival offer from GVC. Bwin shareholders will receive 39.45p and 0.404 new 888 shares for each share they own. The offer represents a value of around 104.9p per Bwin share, which is a premium of approximately 16.4% cent to the closing price of Bwin on 14 May, which is the last business day before Bwin announced talks about a possible tie-up. 
Marks & Spencer (Other OTC: MAKSF - news ) said John Dixon, the executive director of its general merchandise division, will step down from the board with immediate effect and leave the company on a day to be agreed, to pursue other career opportunities. Steve Rowe will take on responsibility for the general merchandise business, while Andy Adcock, who is currently trading director of the food division, will step up to be the director of Food. 
IAG moved closer on Thursday to clinching a takeover of Aer Lingus (LSE: AERL.L - news ) after receiving the US regulator's go-ahead and the Irish carrier's shareholders backed special resolutions linked to the deal. 
Russian mining company Evraz (LSE: EVR.L - news ) said crude steel output was down 14% quarter on quarter, at 3.4mt. Evraz blamed the fall on the deconsolidation of its South African producer and repair and maintenance at Russian mills. 
HomeServe (LSE: HSV.L - news ) is trading in line with its expectations and expects to deliver good growth in 2016. In a trading update for 1 April to 17 July, the home emergency business said that in line with the strategy it previously outlined, it continues to invest for customer growth across its international business and, as in prior years, the majority of marketing activity will be weighted towards the second half. 
RBC Capital Markets upgraded GKN (LSE: GKN.L - news ) to 'sector perform' from 'underperform' but trimmed its target price to 320p from 330p. It noted that GKN shares have underperformed sector peers year-to-date and are now trading at a relatively untesting multiple, even on the bank's consensus forecasts.
